lead_paragraph: Chief Ronald dela Rosa told a Senate hearing that a spike in deaths was being caused by suspects who choose to battle officers instead of surrendering.

byline.contributor: Felipe Villamor reported from Manila, and Richard C. Paddock from Bangkok.
byline.original: By FELIPE VILLAMOR and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

headline.print_headline: Police Blame Drug Suspects in Philippines for Killings
headline.main: Rodrigo Duterte’s Police Chief Blames Suspects for Toll in Philippine Drug War

snippet: Chief Ronald dela Rosa told a Senate hearing that a spike in deaths was being caused by suspects who choose to battle officers instead of surrendering....
abstract: Ronald dela Rosa, top police official in Philippines, blames drug dealers who choose to fight police rather than surrendering for high number of killings by police; says death total has jumped to 1,916 since beginning of Pres Rodrigo Duterte's antidrug campaign on July 1, with 756 being carried out by police officers and rest by vigilantes.
